Markus:

I see you are concerned about a "mistake" (mixing de-ref and
non-d=
e-ref URIs). I don't think this kind of distinction has been
discussed for =
other registered Lin Relation Values (anyone feel free
to point me to some =
helpful examples).

Is there a proposal/suggestion you have regarding this?=
 i.e. "the
following text should appear" or "there should be some guarantee=
 of
de-referenceability if the HTTP scheme is used...", etc.


mca
http://a=
mundsen.com/blog/
http://twitter.com@mamund
http://mamund.com/foaf.rdf#me

=



On Tue, Mar 6, 2012 at 08:01, Markus Lanthaler <markus.lanthaler@...=
> wrote:
> Moore, Jonathan wrote on Tuesday, March 06, 2012 8:12 PM:
>> Spe=
cifying a URI allows you to use both non-dereferenceable
>> URNs as well as=
 dereferenceable URLs. Documenting the syntax
>> as a URI makes it clear th=
at the semantics treat this as an
>> (opaque) identifier when processing.
>=

> I agree. That's why I talked about *HTTP* URIs and using a different sch=
eme
> for non-dereferenceable ones. The I-D should be clear about that. Tha=
t's all
> I wanted to say..
>
